definition: now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: North Korea's hot-and-cold relationship with the outside world will not change.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮和外部世界的這種忽冷忽熱的關係是不會改變的。

sentences.english: Human beings are prone to catching colds under the changeable weather in early spring, so are chimps.
sentences.chinese: 初春天氣忽冷忽熱，人容易感冒，黑猩猩也一樣。

sentences.english: He has an eccentric temper. His attitude towards others is always changing.
sentences.chinese: 他這人脾氣很怪，總是對人忽冷忽熱的。

sentences.english: Don't like that kind of near and far, the feeling of hot and cold doubting.
sentences.chinese: 不喜歡那種忽近忽遠，忽冷忽熱猜不透的感覺。

sentences.english: I don't want you sometimes hot and sometimes cold because I will catch a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我不要你的忽冷忽熱，因爲這樣我會感冒的。

sentences.english: Several days past uncertain weather, rainy & sometimes hot.
sentences.chinese: 這幾天忽冷忽熱，陰晴不定。

sentences.english: When Mary had a fever, she felt cold and hot by turns.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗發燒時，她感到忽冷忽熱。

sentences.english: Her relationship with him was up and down.
sentences.chinese: 她和他的關係忽冷忽熱。

sentences.english: The media, meanwhile, has blown hot and cold on the affair.
sentences.chinese: 同時，媒體對這件事的態度表現得忽冷忽熱。

sentences.english: His enthusiasm for his work blew hot and cold.
sentences.chinese: 在工作上他總是忽冷忽熱有冬有夏。

sentences.english: You sometimes hot and sometimes cold and near and far that I don't want to be.
sentences.chinese: 你的忽冷忽熱忽近忽遠讓我不想再認真。

definition: cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms
to be in a tangle/to nag
Virgo (constellation and sign of the zodiac)/popular variant of 室女座[Shi4 nu:3 zuo4]
lit. seeming neither close nor distant (idiom)/fig. to keep one's distance/(of a relationship) lukewarm/vague
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
